meanings.definition: A person who is slovenly or unkempt in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The schlump at the park had messy hair and wrinkled clothes.
meanings.sent2: She saw a schlump on the street with untied shoelaces and a stained shirt.
meanings.sent3: The schlump at the party wore pajamas and slippers, looking completely out of place.
meanings.sent4: Among the elegant crowd, he felt like a schlump in a tuxedo.
meanings.sent5: The schlump's disheveled appearance made everyone stare.

meanings.definition: To move or walk in a clumsy, lazy manner.
meanings.sent1: He would schlump around the house in his pajamas all day.
meanings.sent2: The tired dog would schlump slowly back to its bed after a long walk.
meanings.sent3: She decided to schlump her way through the obstacle course, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The old car schlumped along the road, barely able to keep up with traffic.
meanings.sent5: The students schlumped into the classroom, dragging their feet on a Monday morning.
